briefdescription.para: Decode log2(u8, q3) scale encoding to float.

detaileddescription.para: Scale bytes for Q4_0 weights use a log2(u8, q3) encoding: exp = (v - 128) * 2^-3 scale = 2^exp

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8_t *W_blocks, const uint8_t *W_scales, size_t scale_bytes, const float *x, float *y, size_t rows, size_t cols, const uint16_t *bias_bf16)
memberdef.name: ie_gemv_q4_0_f32_avx2_impl

simplesect.para: 0 on success, non-zero on invalid arguments.

briefdescription.para: Convert a BF16 value stored as a uint16_t to float.
Initialize log2(u8, q3) LUT for Q4 kernels (generic path).
Load a per-block scale value (BF16 or FP8 E4M3) as float.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to scale storage for the block.

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8_t *blocks, const uint8_t *scales, size_t scale_bytes, const float *x, size_t cols)
memberdef.name: ie_q4_0_row_dot_f32

briefdescription.para: Compute one row dot product for Q4_0 weights.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, non-zero on invalid arguments.

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8_t *W_blocks, const uint8_t *W_scales, size_t scale_bytes, const float *x, float *y, size_t rows, size_t cols, const uint16_t *bias_bf16)
memberdef.name: ie_gemv_q4_0_f32

briefdescription.para: Public Q4_0 GEMV entrypoint with one-time runtime dispatch.

detaileddescription.para: GEMV with Q4_0 weights and FP32 activations.
The dispatch decision is cached after the first call. This avoids the need to modify global kernel initialization routines and ensures the symbol always resolves at link time.

briefdescription.para: Portable Q4_0 GEMV (matrix-vector) kernel with runtime dispatch.

detaileddescription.para: This module implements a Q4_0 matrix-vector multiply used by the GPT-OSS INT4 path. The exported symbol is ie_gemv_q4_0_f32.

The implementation provides:
A portable scalar fallback (always available).
An AVX2+FMA optimized implementation (compiled in a separate TU) selected at runtime when supported by the current CPU.

The Q4_0 layout matches the engine's weight packing:
Each block covers 32 columns.
Blocks store 16 bytes of packed nibbles per 32 weights.
Each block has one scale (BF16, 2 bytes, or FP8 E4M3, 1 byte).

The matrix is represented as two parallel streams:
W_blocks: rows * (cols/32) * 16 bytes
W_scales: rows * (cols/32) * scale_bytes

Signed 4-bit decode (two's complement):
n = (nibble & 0xF)
w = (n >= 8) ? (n - 16) : n -> range [-8, 7]
